column4: I just did a fresh install of 12.04 LTS and all went ok however after updating packages the system hangs on boot. Anyone else experiencing this?
any output what went wrong?
does alt-ctrl-f1 work?
everything update correctly..I did however notice it hangs after Apparmor starts.
I did not try however I was able to get down to root shell by using recovery mode.
ok, but this will not help solving the problem
what should I do in order to solve it?
you should try boot again in normal mode and try to get a shell, if you are not able to get a shell, then I would try disabling appamor
in recovery mode
hmm, but there's an [OK] thingie after the apparmor entry in the boot process..it just hangs after that. I don't think it's Apparmor.
ok, i see... did you wait for a while?
did you have internet connectivity?
for about 30 minutes. The HDD led was blinking from time to time.
it did get past the network initialization I think.
try reboot and press ctrl-d or ctrl-c if it hangs again at that point
I did press it. Nothing happened.
ctrl-alt-f1?
I'll try it. But what should I if it works?
login and dmesg
ok. I'll try it now.
do you have an ssd?
no I don't.
rsumo: I can't access a shell trought ctrl + alt + f1 and disabling apparmor didn't help
I can't access a shell trought ctrl + alt + f1 and disabling apparmor didn't help
